sys_ui_page.description:
This solution is NOT using a Document Template. I am strugging to find a NON-HR related tutorial for using Templates to create PDF.
https://www.dylanlindgren.com/2017/09/30/filling-pdf-forms-in-servicenow/ "The PDF Generator plugin comes with a script include called GeneralPdfUtils, which contains the majority of the functions which we can use to interact with PDF forms."
For the moment... repurposing an arbitrary Incident Record to hold the PDF Fillable Form. I found a fillable PDF from Dylan Lindgren https://community.servicenow.com/community?id=community_blog&sys_id=4acc6265dbd0dbc01dcaf3231f961949 Downloaded that PDF, and then manually attached the PDF to an arbitrary Incident Record.
His code uses "global.GeneralPdfUtils();" I am still not clear if this is part of the PDF Generator plugin or not. He uses code to instrospect the metadata of the PDF file and determine which fields are "fillable".
He then builds a corresponding JSON structure to map between the JSON and PDF internal Structure. I "think" this allows for overwriting of the field content (in-memory).. and subsequently output to Disk. (as attachment to a record).
ISSUE: I can't figure out how to build a PDF from Scratch, nor from HTML. I keep getting errors in the code.
Also checkout a Licensed Solution on the ServiceNow Store: https://store.servicenow.com/sn_appstore_store.do#!/store/application/ad5c5f11f7131200d03eedd0358dff1b/2.2.1?referer=sn_appstore_store.do%23!%2Fstore%2Fsearch%3Fq%3DUXstorm
